column4: CNBC: A federal judge has dismissed a lawsuit against Tesla over Model 3 production targets
Another reason companies should stop giving guidance altogether. Damned if you don't hit targets. Company executives don't have crystal balls.
If Tesla does hit its targets, it's by claiming a per week" production figure that they only achieved for a single week.  Maybe not securities fraud but it is misleading."

While there are some legitimate reasons to support providing guidance on a less frequent basis (yearly or twice-yearly), I'm not sure this article or outcome provides support for that view. It's a contested topic but not super relevant here.
It's a way to avoid these type of lawsuits in the first place and goes to show that investors shouldn't rely on guidance anyway since it could be wrong without consequence.
